comment: Smart Data Models - Solar Energy adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.Energy/master/SolarEnergy/schema.json
description: A Data Model for Solar Energy generation.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataDescriptor
contents.comment: URI pointing to the data-descriptor entity

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: energyGenerated
contents.comment: Energy generated over a specific time range from the energy resource corresponding to this observation.

contents.name: frequency
contents.comment: Frequency observed from the entity corresponding to this observation.

contents.name: maxSolarPowerMeasure
contents.comment: A measure of maximum solar energy that can be generated.

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: observationDateTime
contents.comment: Last reported time of observation.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: totalActivePower
contents.comment: Total active power consumed by all phases.

contents.name: totalEnergyGenerated
contents.comment: Total energy generated by the energy resource corresponding to this observation.

contents.name: totalReactivePower
contents.comment: Total reactive power for all phases.

contents.name: voltage
contents.comment: The value of Voltage in the entity corresponding to this observation.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: activePower
contents.comment: The actual values will beconveyed by subproperties which names will be equal to the name of each of the alternating current phases: L1, L2, L3.

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address

contents.name: current
contents.comment: Electrical current. The actual values will be conveyed by one subproperty per alternating current phase and the neutral wire: L1, L2, L3 and N.

contents.name: phaseCurrent
contents.comment: Current per phase. Ordered triple comprising of active power from three phases in the following order: [R Y B]

contents.name: phaseVoltage
contents.comment: The voltage between each phase and neutral conductor. The actual values will be conveyed by one subproperty per alternating current phase: L1, L2 and L3

contents.name: powerFactor
contents.comment: Power factor for each phase. The actual values will be conveyed by one subproperty per alternating current phase: L1, L2 and L3

contents.name: reactivePower
contents.comment: Fundamental frequency reactive power. The actual values will be conveyed by subproperties whose names will be equal to the name of each of the alternating current phases: L1, L2, L3.
